text.tspan: This is a Meeble.

flowRoot.flowPara: Meebles are virtual critters. They can have different weights (a heavy Meeble is worth more than a light one). You can't touch them - they're virtual, remember? - but you can have them under your command, so when you tell them to do things, they will obey.

text.tspan: 15lb
1lb
You can think of ownership like this: however many
Meebles listen to my commands, those are the ones
I own.
And since they're valued by weight, if I have
a 1lb Meeble and a 15lb Meeble, I own 16lb
of Meebles total.
What if I want to give my friend Bob 5lb of Meeble?
Pretty easy - I tell my 15-pounder to split into 2 new
Meebles, a 5-pounder and a 10-pounder. Then I can
give the 5-pounder to Bob.
Most Meeble controller devices don't even show you
individual Meebles - they quietly handle all the
splitting and totalling for you, under the hood. So
you can just say, "Give Bob 5lb worth of Meeble,"
and as long as you have that much to give, it happens.
Pop.
But how do I control my Meebles? Guess I better read Page 2 of
The Layman's Guide to Meebles
